intro: Sisymbrium andinum var. hastatum, commonly known as the Andean rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are typically lobed or divided, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. This species is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of mountainous ecosystems.
